data.title: AMBER: Fast pipeline for detecting single-pulse radio transients
data.name: AMBER
data.description: A many-core transient searching pipeline, designed to search in real-time for Fast Radio Bursts.

evidence: "AMBER: a Fast Radio Burst real-time pipeline" and description as "a many-core accelerated and fully auto-tuned pipeline for detecting Fast Radio Bursts" indicate it is an application pipeline used directly for scientific detection tasks.
The README lists scientific publications about the pipeline, showing it is core to producing research results: "AMBER: A real-time pipeline for the detection of single pulse astronomical transients".

Installation is via a setup script from GitHub, with no mention of package managers or binaries: "The easiest way to install AMBER is by using the AMBER_setup script," implying distribution via the source repository.
